title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe the ecological niche that is occupied by the dominant native plant community that inhabits region C, based on the distribution of biomes in the United States, such as any of the following:

· Region C is a boreal forest dominated by evergreen species such as pine, spruce, fir, etc.

· Region C is a temperate seasonal forest dominated by deciduous species such as oak, beech, elm, etc.

· Region C is a boreal forest with low average temperatures and high average annual precipitation.

· Region C is a temperate seasonal forest with low average annual temperatures and high average annual precipitation.

· Plants in Region C have adaptions to temperate or boreal conditions (e.g., needles or leaves).

The response describes the ecological niche that is occupied by the dominant native plant community that inhabits region C, based on the distribution of biomes in the United States, such as one of the following:

· Region C is a boreal forest dominated by evergreen species such as pine, spruce, fir, etc.

· Region C is a temperate seasonal forest dominated by deciduous species such as oak, beech, elm, etc.

· Region C is a boreal forest with low average temperatures and high average annual precipitation.

· Region C is a temperate seasonal forest with low average annual temperatures and high average annual precipitation.

· Plants in Region C have adaptions to temperate or boreal conditions (e.g., needles or leaves).

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe one climate characteristic difference between regions B and D that could be studied to help explain the western corn rootworm infestation rate difference between the two regions, such as any of the following:

· Region B receives less precipitation than region D.

· Region B has higher average temperatures than region D.

· Region B has a warmer summer than region D.

· Region D has cooler temperatures due to higher altitudes.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not explain why the effectiveness of Bt MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeOqaiaabshaaaa@37B0@ corn against the western corn rootworm may decrease after many years of growing the crop, if it reduces, but doesn’t entirely eliminate, the western corn rootworm problem, such as the following:

· Rootworms that that are resistant to the Bt MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeOqaiaabshaaaa@37B0@ corn, will survive and pass genes for resistance on to their offspring. Eventually, the rootworm population will evolve to be increasingly resistant to the defenses of the Bt MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeOqaiaabshaaaa@37B0@ crop and either more pesticide will need to be applied to control the population or the corn crop will decrease from the pest.

The response explains why the effectiveness of Bt MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeOqaiaabshaaaa@37B0@ corn against the western corn rootworm may decrease after many years of growing the crop, if it reduces, but doesn’t entirely eliminate, the western corn rootworm problem, such as the following:

· Rootworms that that are resistant to the Bt MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeOqaiaabshaaaa@37B0@ corn, will survive and pass genes for resistance on to their offspring. Eventually, the rootworm population will evolve to be increasingly resistant to the defenses of the Bt MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeOqaiaabshaaaa@37B0@ crop and either more pesticide will need to be applied to control the population or the corn crop will decrease from the pest.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe one impact that the increase in herbicide application would likely have on the environment, such as any of the following:

· Increased concentration of herbicide in runoff

· Increased groundwater contamination /surface water contamination of herbicide

· Beneficial and native species killed/decreased biodiversity

· Increased soil erosion and loss of soil fertility

title: Part F

descriptions:
The response does not describe one way that HT MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaeisaiaabsfaaaa@3796@ soybeans are used, other than to create food for human consumption, such as any of the following:

title: Part G
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe one environmental problem that is likely to result from the land use change to convert native forests to cropland, such as any of the following:

· The conversion to agriculture destroys forest habitat resulting in the loss of biodiversity.

· The loss of cover from forest vegetation increases soil erosion from wind and water.

· The harvest of crops/clearing of native forests reduces carbon sequestration in biomass and soils.

· Agricultural activities increase the use of fertilizers or pesticides, which can run off and pollute waterways.

The response describes one environmental problem that is likely to result from the land use change to convert native forests to cropland, such as one of the following:

· The conversion to agriculture destroys forest habitat resulting in the loss of biodiversity.

· The loss of cover from forest vegetation increases soil erosion from wind and water.

· The harvest of crops/clearing of native forests reduces carbon sequestration in biomass and soils.

· Agricultural activities increase the use of fertilizers or pesticides, which can run off and pollute waterways.

title: Part H
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not make a claim that proposes a solution to the environmental problem identified in part (g), such as any of the following:

The conversion to agriculture destroys the forest habitat resulting in the loss of biodiversity (problem in part (g)).

· Establish areas of critical habitat in the cropland

· Designate areas of the forest as a preserve

The loss of cover from forest vegetation increases soil erosion from wind and water (problem in part (g)).

· Designate areas of the forest as a preserve to keep some areas with trees/tree roots

The harvest of crops/clearing of native forests reduces carbon sequestration in biomass and soils (problem in part (g)).

· Designate areas of the forest as a preserve

Agricultural activities increase the use of fertilizers or pesticides, which can runoff and pollute waterways (problem in part (g)).

· Plant buffer zones around the edges of the cropland
